statsguruLinks.title: Sri Lanka's totals batting first in Mirpur

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Mahmudullah b Arafat Sunny 128 (115b 14x4 0x6 181m) SR: 111.3

dismissalComment.html: Mahmudullah has made amends immediately, snares a good, tumbling catch on the long-on boundary to dismiss Sanga. It was tossed up on leg stump, made him go down on one knee and he lofted it. Think he got under it a bit too much as this got more height than distance. Mahmudullah runs to his left and had his eyes on the ball all the way into both his hands

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashan Priyanjan lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 60 (97b 7x4 0x6 90m) SR: 61.85

dismissalComment.html: tossed up on middle as he looks to sweep. Gets struck low on the front pad and Shakib knew it as he went for the appeal! This one slides on with the arm and hits him in front of off stump as Priyanjan tried to get outside the line. Wasn't too successful

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: cut straight into the hands of point! Might have been a bit more bounce there than he expected. Still slams it away and Shamsur has held on to a pretty sharp catch! It was short and wide, probably one of the worse balls he would bowl to get a wicket but Rubel doesn't mind. Neither does Bangladesh as they rejoice after the early success

goes for a pull and he gets a leading edge to mid-off. Rubel roars! It was not short enough to pull, especially when he was on the front foot. He didn't have enough room to free his hands either. Another failure for Dilshan as he dies by the sword. I wonder how much that blow to his thumb contributed to his dismissal.

outside edge, caught at short third man! Fuller delivery homing in on off stump and Thisara was looking for quick runs as he seeks the leg side boundary, but the ball skews away to Mahmudullah again who clings on to a simple chance. Bangladesh hitting back big time here, but is it too late?

dismissalText.long: c Shamsur Rahman b Sohag Gazi
dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c Shamsur Rahman b Sohag Gazi 9 (14b 0x4 0x6 20m) SR: 64.28

dismissalComment.html: that's a dolly to midwicket and Gazi has struck! This flighted delivery stopped on the pitch and came at him a lot slower than he expected. Chandimal's closed face of the bat results in a leading edge which is pouched with the greatest ease

dismissalComment.html: Mahmudullah has made amends immediately, snares a good, tumbling catch on the long-on boundary to dismiss Sanga. It was tossed up on leg stump, made him go down on one knee and he lofted it. Think he got under it a bit too much as this got more height than distance. Mahmudullah runs to his left and had his eyes on the ball all the way into both his hands

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Mahmudullah b Rubel Hossain 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: outside edge, caught at short third man! Fuller delivery homing in on off stump and Thisara was looking for quick runs as he seeks the leg side boundary, but the ball skews away to Mahmudullah again who clings on to a simple chance. Bangladesh hitting back big time here, but is it too late?

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Senanayake b Malinga 79 (83b 5x4 2x6 124m) SR: 95.18

dismissalComment.html: the extra ball does the trick for Sri Lanka. Mushi's steered it straight to point! He had kept out so many good yorkers, but this time he was searching for a single to retain strike. Tried to guide it to the left of point, but Senanayake dives to his left and snares a good, low catch. MIght well be the end of Bangladesh's chase tonight. Terrific innings from their captain, if only he'd had a little support

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque lbw b NLTC Perera 42 (46b 7x4 0x6 59m) SR: 91.3

dismissalComment.html: plays across a straight ball, which came back in just enough and is struck in front of off stump! Think that might have kept low and he was up on his toes trying to flick it through square leg. Poor shot selection sees him forsake another good start

edged and taken by Sanga, what a ball! what a take! Tossed up and lured him forward and out of his crease. His balance was totally shot and Mominul was looking to play against the turn as he closes the face of the bat and the outside edge is substantial, but Sanga moves fluidly to his left behind the stumps and takes a lovely grab

that's it! Leading edge to cover and so Sri Lanka have swept the tour, winning the one-day series as well! Good length ball turning in on off stump, he had shuffled across to clip it through midwicket, but had closed the face too early and succumbs

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: straight to deep midwicket! That is the softest of dismissals. Flighted on middle and leg, he clears his front hip and heaves it away. But there is a man in the deep and he swallows it quite easily. Nasir is distraught, his captain at the other end is even more so. This is terrible batting from Bangladesh. They need partnerships, not big hits

so he'll go over midwicket, but he cannot clear the man in the deep. The search for a big hit consumes another Bangladesh batsman. Picks up the one that turns into him and slogs wildly but all he manages to do is drop it down the throat of Thisara Perera

dismissalText.commentary: Shamsur Rahman c Senanayake b Malinga 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and just as I type that, Shamsur guides one to the second slip! Another awayswinger again and Shamur was lured into fishing outside his off stump. Regulation edge goes low and to his left, Senanayake, who is nicknamed Jonty, dives and clings on to a very sharp chance.

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c †Sangakkara b Senanayake 15 (32b 1x4 0x6 47m) SR: 46.87

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken by Sanga, what a ball! what a take! Tossed up and lured him forward and out of his crease. His balance was totally shot and Mominul was looking to play against the turn as he closes the face of the bat and the outside edge is substantial, but Sanga moves fluidly to his left behind the stumps and takes a lovely grab

headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Senanayake b Priyanjan 24 (23b 2x4 1x6 31m) SR: 104.34

dismissalComment.html: holes out at long-off and Shakib is furious with himself. It was an innocuous delivery, tossed up outside off. He just couldn't hold himself back, charges down the track and lofts it straight into the hands of Senanayake. Falling to a part-timer at this stage of the game, that's terrible!

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah run out (MDKJ Perera/Priyanjan) 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: Mahmudullah is gone run-out now! Bangladesh are imploding! Mushi took a few steps forward and then decides no and has sold his partner down the river. Flighted ball on middle and leg, turned behind square. Short fine leg is incredibly quick to the ball and sends a good flat throw to the bowler, who takes off the bails. Mahmudullah had given up, that was how far he had charged out

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sohag Gazi c †Sangakkara b NLTC Perera 7 (11b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: he's guided it straight into the hands of the keeper! Sanga picks up a good low catch. He was looking to guide the length ball to third man but gets too fine an edge. There was a little question about whether it carried or not, but Sanga claimed the catch and he is right. It did not bounce

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain c sub (AK Perera) b Senanayake 6 (6b 0x4 1x6 5m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: that's it! Leading edge to cover and so Sri Lanka have swept the tour, winning the one-day series as well! Good length ball turning in on off stump, he had shuffled across to clip it through midwicket, but had closed the face too early and succumbs

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain c sub (AK Perera) b Senanayake 6 (6b 0x4 1x6 5m) SR: 100

commentTextItems.html: that's it! Leading edge to cover and so Sri Lanka have swept the tour, winning the one-day series as well! Good length ball turning in on off stump, he had shuffled across to clip it through midwicket, but had closed the face too early and succumbs

commentPostTextItems.html: 8.35 pm So that's all we have for you from commentary. Sri Lanka wrap up a well-deserved victory and take an unassailable 2-0 lead. But there is still one more ODI left in the series. That starts Saturday, same time so we look forward to your company and your comments then. But for now, This is Alagappan Muthu saying sayonara

Kumar Sangakkara is the Man of the Match "No, I didn't know I had made 1000 runs against Bangladesh in ODIs. The wicket was pretty good and I was just trying to score as many runs as I can. Trained hard in the nets, made sure I was clear-minded out there and I just wanted to knock it to the sweepers and pick up the singles. The side needed a big knock and I'm glad I delivered. I wasn't worried. Ashan [Priyanjan] struggled a bit, but he fought it out. Angelo was the really important innings, came in and pushed things on. So did Kithuruwan. Just a bit of advice when he [Priyanjan] lost his focus. Keep it simple and don't throw it away. There are time to take risks but then we needed a partnership. He's a good player for us and if he gets his focus clear, he's going to be a player to watch. No secret, just good focus, working hard in the nets. Keeping fit and I'm part of a very good, young side"

"The boys played brilliantly," says Angelo Mathews. We were in a spot of bother when the veteran come in to bat and guided the innings wonderfully with Ashan Priyanjan. I'm enjoying my batting too. Getting it off the middle nicely. He [Priyanjan] bowled to me in the nets and I just couldn't play him so the move worked today. We got a bit more time to acclimatise for the Asia cup and hopefully we do well there too"

8.25 pm "Yeah, I guess the way the boys are getting out is really disappointing. When you get set especially while chasing 290, you should stay on" says Mushfiqur Rahim . "We were getting a couple of partnerships going with Nasir and Shakib, but we lost it. That is where we should learn from Sanga and Mathews. They batted really well. We lost a few early wickets, but we were never too far behind in the run-rate. We are playing for our country so the last match is still important and we will do our best to win"

8.15 pm It was a one-man show from Bangladesh as well, the only trouble was there was no one playing second fiddle to Mushfiqur Rahim's battling half-century. Bangladesh kept losing wickets through rather rash batting. It almost seemed as if Sri Lanka sat back and let the hosts implode. Very disciplined bowling from them, especially the spinners led by Sachithra Senanayake, who apart from his two wickets took two sharp catches as well. Stick around for the presentation.
Rajindra: "Sri Lanka Played cricket while Bangladesh played BASEBALL (except Mushfiqur Bhai). So today Cricket has won against BASEBALL! lol!!!"

commentTextItems.html: loads of flight and almost yorks him. Kept out though
bounce and turn this time cautions Rubel from going for a heave. Dabs it down the pitch
shuffles across and blocks the length ball outside off
length ball with a bit of room outside off, Rubel goes down on one knee and slogs him over midwicket. Meaty strike
goes back and punches to backward point
tossed up but this slides down leg. The keeper can't collect it cleanly

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Senanayake b Malinga 79 (83b 5x4 2x6 124m) SR: 95.18

commentTextItems.html: the extra ball does the trick for Sri Lanka. Mushi's steered it straight to point! He had kept out so many good yorkers, but this time he was searching for a single to retain strike. Tried to guide it to the left of point, but Senanayake dives to his left and snares a good, low catch. MIght well be the end of Bangladesh's chase tonight. Terrific innings from their captain, if only he'd had a little support

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: this one leaps off back of a length, but Sunny does well. Soft hands nudges it towards the leg side
full toss on off stump, whips it to mid-on from the crease
very full on off stump, brings down an angled bat to steer it to point
shortish with a bit of room outside off, stays leg side and cuts it away to deep cover and takes the single. Sunny has four balls to face. He better be careful of his toes
great yorker on leg stump but Mushi's defence is strong indeed

commentPreTextItems.html: HMN: "One of the things SL desperately need in all forms of the game is that 'killer instinct'....never allow any chance/room for the opposition!!!!!"

commentTextItems.html: slower ball pushed through down the leg side, wided

commentPreTextItems.html: Arafat Sunny has one ball to face

commentTextItems.html: flighted on the pads, nudged away towards square leg

commentPostTextItems.html: Goni: "just as i was about to write..... 'please mashrafe, do not get carried away when you hit a 6 or a 4. normally you play too many big shorts and get out'..........He gets out!"

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c NLTC Perera b Mendis 17 (23b 2x4 1x6 38m) SR: 73.91

commentTextItems.html: so he'll go over midwicket, but he cannot clear the man in the deep. The search for a big hit consumes another Bangladesh batsman. Picks up the one that turns into him and slogs wildly but all he manages to do is drop it down the throat of Thisara Perera
inside out and that has been slapped over cover! Mendis is being massacred here as Mashrafe moves outside leg, moves forward and gives it his all. Great power from the former captain
stays leg side of this and creams the length ball with the turn through the covers. These two are not giving up by a long shot
spins away from him as he goes for a massive heave over the leg side. Cannot connect

commentPreTextItems.html: Ajantha Mendis with a great big towel clipped to his trousers comes on

commentTextItems.html: pushes to long-on for a single

It was short and wide, probably one of the worse balls he would bowl to get a wicket but Rubel doesn't mind. Neither does Bangladesh as they rejoice after the early success

goes for a pull and he gets a leading edge to mid-off. Rubel roars! It was not short enough to pull, especially when he was on the front foot. He didn't have enough room to free his hands either. Another failure for Dilshan as he dies by the sword. I wonder how much that blow to his thumb contributed to his dismissal.

outside edge, caught at short third man! Fuller delivery homing in on off stump and Thisara was looking for quick runs as he seeks the leg side boundary, but the ball skews away to Mahmudullah again who clings on to a simple chance. Bangladesh hitting back big time here, but is it too late?

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's a dolly to midwicket and Gazi has struck! This flighted delivery stopped on the pitch and came at him a lot slower than he expected. Chandimal's closed face of the bat results in a leading edge which is pouched with the greatest ease

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: tossed up on middle as he looks to sweep. Gets struck low on the front pad and Shakib knew it as he went for the appeal! This one slides on with the arm and hits him in front of off stump as Priyanjan tried to get outside the line. Wasn't too successful

Mahmudullah has made amends immediately, snares a good, tumbling catch on the long-on boundary to dismiss Sanga. It was tossed up on leg stump, made him go down on one knee and he lofted it. Think he got under it a bit too much as this got more height than distance. Mahmudullah runs to his left and had his eyes on the ball all the way into both his hands

dismissalText.long: c Shamsur Rahman b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c Shamsur Rahman b Rubel Hossain 8 (7b 2x4 0x6 8m) SR: 114.28

dismissalComment.html: cut straight into the hands of point! Might have been a bit more bounce there than he expected. Still slams it away and Shamsur has held on to a pretty sharp catch! It was short and wide, probably one of the worse balls he would bowl to get a wicket but Rubel doesn't mind. Neither does Bangladesh as they rejoice after the early success

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 8 (16b 1x4 0x6 38m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: goes for a pull and he gets a leading edge to mid-off. Rubel roars! It was not short enough to pull, especially when he was on the front foot. He didn't have enough room to free his hands either. Another failure for Dilshan as he dies by the sword. I wonder how much that blow to his thumb contributed to his dismissal.

dismissalText.long: c Shamsur Rahman b Sohag Gazi
dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c Shamsur Rahman b Sohag Gazi 9 (14b 0x4 0x6 20m) SR: 64.28

dismissalComment.html: that's a dolly to midwicket and Gazi has struck! This flighted delivery stopped on the pitch and came at him a lot slower than he expected. Chandimal's closed face of the bat results in a leading edge which is pouched with the greatest ease

headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashan Priyanjan lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 60 (97b 7x4 0x6 90m) SR: 61.85

dismissalComment.html: tossed up on middle as he looks to sweep. Gets struck low on the front pad and Shakib knew it as he went for the appeal! This one slides on with the arm and hits him in front of off stump as Priyanjan tried to get outside the line. Wasn't too successful

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Mahmudullah b Arafat Sunny 128 (115b 14x4 0x6 181m) SR: 111.3

dismissalComment.html: Mahmudullah has made amends immediately, snares a good, tumbling catch on the long-on boundary to dismiss Sanga. It was tossed up on leg stump, made him go down on one knee and he lofted it. Think he got under it a bit too much as this got more height than distance. Mahmudullah runs to his left and had his eyes on the ball all the way into both his hands

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Mahmudullah b Rubel Hossain 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: outside edge, caught at short third man! Fuller delivery homing in on off stump and Thisara was looking for quick runs as he seeks the leg side boundary, but the ball skews away to Mahmudullah again who clings on to a simple chance. Bangladesh hitting back big time here, but is it too late?

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque lbw b NLTC Perera 42 (46b 7x4 0x6 59m) SR: 91.3

dismissalComment.html: plays across a straight ball, which came back in just enough and is struck in front of off stump! Think that might have kept low and he was up on his toes trying to flick it through square leg. Poor shot selection sees him forsake another good start

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Shamsur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shamsur Rahman  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shamsur Rahman c Senanayake b Malinga 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and just as I type that, Shamsur guides one to the second slip! Another awayswinger again and Shamur was lured into fishing outside his off stump. Regulation edge goes low and to his left, Senanayake, who is nicknamed Jonty, dives and clings on to a very sharp chance.

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c †Sangakkara b Senanayake 15 (32b 1x4 0x6 47m) SR: 46.87

dismissalComment.html: edged and taken by Sanga, what a ball! what a take! Tossed up and lured him forward and out of his crease. His balance was totally shot and Mominul was looking to play against the turn as he closes the face of the bat and the outside edge is substantial, but Sanga moves fluidly to his left behind the stumps and takes a lovely grab

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Senanayake b Malinga 79 (83b 5x4 2x6 124m) SR: 95.18

dismissalComment.html: the extra ball does the trick for Sri Lanka. Mushi's steered it straight to point! He had kept out so many good yorkers, but this time he was searching for a single to retain strike. Tried to guide it to the left of point, but Senanayake dives to his left and snares a good, low catch. MIght well be the end of Bangladesh's chase tonight. Terrific innings from their captain, if only he'd had a little support

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Senanayake b Priyanjan 24 (23b 2x4 1x6 31m) SR: 104.34

dismissalComment.html: holes out at long-off and Shakib is furious with himself. It was an innocuous delivery, tossed up outside off. He just couldn't hold himself back, charges down the track and lofts it straight into the hands of Senanayake. Falling to a part-timer at this stage of the game, that's terrible!

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kithuruwan Vithanage player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Vithanage b Mendis 22 (24b 1x4 1x6 23m) SR: 91.66

dismissalComment.html: straight to deep midwicket! That is the softest of dismissals. Flighted on middle and leg, he clears his front hip and heaves it away. But there is a man in the deep and he swallows it quite easily. Nasir is distraught, his captain at the other end is even more so. This is terrible batting from Bangladesh. They need partnerships, not big hits

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah run out (MDKJ Perera/Priyanjan) 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: Mahmudullah is gone run-out now! Bangladesh are imploding! Mushi took a few steps forward and then decides no and has sold his partner down the river. Flighted ball on middle and leg, turned behind square. Short fine leg is incredibly quick to the ball and sends a good flat throw to the bowler, who takes off the bails. Mahmudullah had given up, that was how far he had charged out

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sohag Gazi  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sohag Gazi c †Sangakkara b NLTC Perera 7 (11b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: he's guided it straight into the hands of the keeper! Sanga picks up a good low catch. He was looking to guide the length ball to third man but gets too fine an edge. There was a little question about whether it carried or not, but Sanga claimed the catch and he is right. It did not bounce

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c NLTC Perera b Mendis 17 (23b 2x4 1x6 38m) SR: 73.91

dismissalComment.html: so he'll go over midwicket, but he cannot clear the man in the deep. The search for a big hit consumes another Bangladesh batsman. Picks up the one that turns into him and slogs wildly but all he manages to do is drop it down the throat of Thisara Perera

dismissalText.commentary: Arafat Sunny not out 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 25

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Perea player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Perea player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rubel Hossain c sub (AK Perera) b Senanayake 6 (6b 0x4 1x6 5m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: that's it! Leading edge to cover and so Sri Lanka have swept the tour, winning the one-day series as well! Good length ball turning in on off stump, he had shuffled across to clip it through midwicket, but had closed the face too early and succumbs

notes: Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 52 runs, 2 wickets)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 9.3 overs (57 balls), Extras 1
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 70/3 in 16.0 overs (KC Sangakkara 38, SMA Priyanjan 3)
KC Sangakkara: 50 off 52 balls (6 x 4)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 23.1 overs (139 balls), Extras 4
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 80 balls (KC Sangakkara 24, SMA Priyanjan 23, Ex 3)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 30.6 overs (186 balls), Extras 6
SMA Priyanjan: 50 off 85 balls (6 x 4)
4th Wicket: 100 runs in 128 balls (KC Sangakkara 44, SMA Priyanjan 51, Ex 5)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 167/3 in 35.0 overs (KC Sangakkara 83, SMA Priyanjan 53)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 22 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 41.3 overs (249 balls), Extras 6
KC Sangakkara: 100 off 102 balls (9 x 4)
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 42 balls (KC Sangakkara 22, AD Mathews 28, Ex 0)
Sri Lanka: 250 runs in 45.1 overs (271 balls), Extras 6
AD Mathews: 50 off 36 balls (5 x 4, 1 x 6)
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 289/6 in 50.0 overs (AD Mathews 56, KDK Vithanage 13)
Bangladesh innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 43 runs, 1 wicket)
Bangladesh: 50 runs in 11.3 overs (70 balls), Extras 3
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 65 balls (Anamul Haque 34, Mominul Haque 15, Ex 2)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 87/3 in 17.0 overs (Mushfiqur Rahim 21, Shakib Al Hasan 5)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 19.3 overs (118 balls), Extras 5
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 36 balls (Mushfiqur Rahim 26, Shakib Al Hasan 23, Ex 2)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 28.1 overs (170 balls), Extras 6
Mushfiqur Rahim: 50 off 57 balls (3 x 4, 1 x 6)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 174/7 in 35.0 overs (Mushfiqur Rahim 53, Mashrafe Mortaza 1)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 32 runs, 0 wicket)
Bangladesh: 200 runs in 39.1 overs (236 balls), Extras 10

milestones.description: Shakib has become the top scorer for BAN in ODIs with 3715 runs, going past Tamim Iqbal's 3702
Shakib has scored 30 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record

stories.title: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 2013-14
stories.subTitle: 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 2013-14
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the second ODI, Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 2013-14

stories.title: BCB requested to reduce Shakib ban
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh news
stories.seoTitle: BCB requested to reduce Shakib Al Hasan ban
stories.summary: Mushfiqur Rahim, the Bangladesh captain, has confirmed that there was a request made to the BCB president Nazmul Hassan to reduce Shakib Al Hasan's suspension

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan picked up a couple of quick wickets
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan picked up a couple of quick wickets, Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 1st T20, Chittagong, February 12, 2014

stories.title: A punishment that should have come earlier
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh cricket
stories.seoTitle: A punishment that should have come earlier
stories.summary: Shakib Al Hasan has had discipline issues in the past, and had he been pulled up earlier this latest incident may not have occurred

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan took 2 for 20 in four overs
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan took 2 for 20 in four overs, Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 1st T20, Bulawayo, May 11, 2013

stories.title: Shakib suspended for three ODIs
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh news
stories.seoTitle: Shakib Al Hasan suspended for three ODIs
stories.summary: Bangladesh allrounder Shakib Al Hasan has been banned for three matches by the BCB for "making an inappropriate gesture on live television" during the second ODI against Sri Lanka

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan chides himself as Sri Lanka's players celebrate his dismissal
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan chides himself as Sri Lanka's players celebrate his dismissal, Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Mirpur, February 20, 2014

stories.title: 'Sangakkara showed his class again' - Mathews
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'Kumar Sangakkara showed his class again' - Angelo Mathews
stories.summary: Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews praised Kumar Sangakkara for his century on Thursday, which helped the side beat Bangladesh by 61 runs and claim the series 2-0

image.caption: Angelo Mathews and Kumar Sangakkara put on 83 together

stories.title: Shakib suspended for three ODIs
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh news
stories.seoTitle: Shakib Al Hasan suspended for three ODIs
stories.summary: Bangladesh allrounder Shakib Al Hasan has been banned for three matches by the BCB for "making an inappropriate gesture on live television" during the second ODI against Sri Lanka
